The last bookmarks I saved manually on my HD are over 10 yrs old. I'll probably have to start from scratch; a huge job.

To make matters worse, I tried to use the 'inspector' to recover an old Mozilla password that showed up as dots (from 2018) and I couldn't. So I had to change my password, which practically guarantees that I can't retrieve the old bookmarks.

Can anyone help? Thanks so much

title: Persistent “Paste” tooltip appears automatically in recipient form on Banco Santander Chile website, blocking input.
content:
Steps to reproduce: Open https://banco.santander.cl and log in. Go to the transfer section and choose to add a new recipient. Click into the "Nombre o alias" field. The “Paste” floating tooltip appears immediately, even though no right-click or paste action has been triggered.

Actual result: A tooltip with only the option “Paste” appears automatically. No other context menu options are visible—just “Paste.” While the tooltip is open, it blocks all keyboard input into the field. To close the tooltip, I must either click on it multiple times with the left mouse button, or press Esc. Once it’s closed, I can enter a few characters, but then the tooltip reappears and blocks input again, repeating the cycle.

Additional notes: The issue occurs in Firefox 138.0.1 (64-bit) and has also occurred in earlier versions. It does not happen in Chrome, Edge, or on the mobile app. It persists even when: 

 Using Firefox Safe Mode  Testing with a fresh Firefox profile  It has been observed on two separate PCs, one running Windows 10 and another running Windows 11

This behavior makes it nearly impossible to input a recipient’s name using Firefox on this site.

Any sugestions on how to solve it or shoud i report it like a bug?
creator: franciscoalarcon

title: Firefox hangs on "Trying to install Helper Tool"
content:
I'm currently using MacOS 15.4.1 Sequoia with FireFox 138.0.1. It works fine after updating from 138.0.0 on my primary (Administrator) account. However, there is a second User account on this MacBook Pro laptop, used by other family members. All is not well here... Firefox updated itself from 137.0.0 recently and now will not run on the User account. On startup, it asks for an Administrator password to install a Helper tool and then will proceed no further. I have tried :-

Making the User account into Administrator - still hangs Cancel and re-start FireFox - hangs! Re-start the MacBook from cold - hangs! Cleaned Firefox installation and folders in the User Library (both User and Administrator) - still hangs! I'm aware there are two Library folders, one each for the System and one for each user, didn't touch the System Library. Added a new User account - it works! So maybe something in the System Library is the culprit? I've always regarded that area as "off limits" to us mere mortals, so please, not the "Wipe it and Start Again" option.

I don't really want to kill the User account, there is a lot of data in there and surely will miss something important if I delete it.

Summary, 137.0.0 worked, it updated to 138.0.1, it hangs up! I am unable to fix it. Any offers guys?

title: Persistent "privacy.resistFingerprinting = true" warning despite being set to false
content:
Hi Mozilla Support Community,

I'm having an issue with Firefox where a console warning appears: "This error message will be blank when privacy.resistFingerprinting = true. If it is really necessary, please add it to the whitelist in MediaError::GetMessage:" while streaming audio on my site (https://osirisfm.org, streaming from https://d3jkr2fyv4ub9q.cloudfront.net/stream). The warning persists even though I've set privacy.resistFingerprinting to false in about:config.

Here’s what I’ve tried: - Set privacy.resistFingerprinting to false, cleared cache, and restarted Firefox, but the warning still shows. - The warning incorrectly indicates privacy.resistFingerprinting = true, despite my setting being false. - Tested with privacy.resistFingerprinting = true and added exemptions for osirisfm.org and d3jkr2fyv4ub9q.cloudfront.net in privacy.resistFingerprinting.exemptedDomains, but it didn’t help. - Ran Firefox in Safe Mode (no add-ons), and the warning still appears. - This doesn’t affect audio playback but prevents seeing the full MediaError.message (e.g., object { code: 1, message: "" }), which makes debugging stream issues difficult.

Is this a known privacy/security setting issue? How can I stop this warning or see the full error message with privacy.resistFingerprinting set to false? Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks!
creator: fierrichu

title: firefox auto-closes after 5 minutes in Yahoo email.
content: Since the last update, (4/30) Foxfire auto-closes after about 5 minutes. “Help, About Firefox”, lists version “115.23.0esr (64-bit)” as current. I do not remember the “esr” in the version previously. Was I sent the wrong update? I still run under Windows 7 to avoid a hardware replacement which works for my usual desktop software. Is Window 7 related to the problem? My e-mail is via Yahoo at “https://mail.yahoo.com/d/folders/ …” which switches to an ATT.com site. Tried going directly to email via ATT.com and the auto-close was faster. A test sitting at the ATT login prompt for 15+ minutes without loging in did not auto-close. I also have a soft recall of looking for help on the Mozilla site for well over 5 minute without the auto-close. Is Yahoo/ATT email the issue. If so, do I need to talk to them? Directory “PC:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Maintenance Service\UpdateLogs ” has 3 files with 4/30/25 dates which is about when problem started. I can email file fro any directory subtree starting with MOZILLA\ if it will help diagnose the issue. Howard Neuschaefer neuscha@sbcglobal.net
creator: neuscha
